content: SEC. 101. Extension of the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families Block Grant Program through March 31, 2004. Activities authorized by part A of title IV of the Social Security Act, and by sections 510, 1108(b), and 1925 of such Act, shall continue through March 31, 2004, in the manner authorized for fiscal year 2002. Grants and payments may be made for carrying out such activities during the first two quarters of fiscal year 2004 at the level provided for the first two quarters of fiscal year 2002. Amendments are made for supplemental grants for population increases in certain states. Amendments are made to various sections of the Social Security Act, including extending activities authorized under part A of title IV through March 31, 2004, in line with fiscal year 2002. Changes include updating dates from 2003 to 2004 and maintaining effort levels for 2004 and 2005. SEC. 102 extends the National Random Sample Study of Child Welfare and Child Welfare Waiver Authority through March 31, 2004, with necessary appropriations. Grants and payments will be made for activities in the first two quarters of fiscal year 2004 at the level provided for in 2002. SEC. 201 allows disclosure of return information for income contingent repayment of student loans. SEC. 202 extends the Internal Revenue Service user fees until December 31, 2004, for requests made after September 30, 2003. The Secretary will establish a program for user fees on requests to the IRS for ruling letters, opinion letters, and determination letters. Fees will vary by category, be based on request complexity, and must be paid in advance. The Secretary can grant exemptions or reduced fees as needed. The Secretary will not require user fees for certain requests regarding pension plans under the program. This exemption applies to requests for determination letters on the qualified status of pension benefit plans maintained by eligible employers or trusts. The Revenue Act of 1987 and the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 are repealed. Fees collected under section 7528 of the Internal Revenue Code must be approved by an appropriations Act before being spent by the IRS. The amendments apply to requests made after the enactment of this Act. Additionally, COBRA fees are extended until March 31, 2004. SEC. 401. Extension of Medicare cost-sharing for certain qualifying individuals. Extension of Sunset for Medicare Cost-Sharing: Amends Section 1902(a)(10)(E)(iv) of the Social Security Act to extend the sunset provision to March 2004. Total Amount Available for Allocation: Modifies Section 1933(c) to include fiscal year 2003 in addition to fiscal year 2002 for allocation purposes. Section 1933 of the Social Security Act is amended to include a special rule for the first quarter of 2004, with a total allocation amount of $100,000,000. SEC. 402 extends the provision equalizing urban and rural standardized Medicare inpatient hospital payments. The provision equalizing urban and rural standardized Medicare inpatient hospital payments is extended until March 31, 2004, with the option for the Secretary of Health and Human Services to delay implementation if necessary. The Secretary may delay implementing amendments until November 1, 2003, with adjustments for fiscal year 2004 to ensure total payments remain unchanged. This delay will not impact subsequent payment periods. The application of subparagraphs (A) and (B) will not affect payment rates after September 30, 2004.
